paper_abstract: This article explores the challenges associated with supporting geospatial retrievals constrained by arbitrary geometric bounds, geographic proximity, and relevance rankings. The proposed solution involves the use of the geoavailability grid, a lightweight, distributed spatial indexing structure. The index can also be used in nondistributed settings, and performs competitively with other spatial indexing technologies.
paper_title: Evaluating Geospatial Geometry and Proximity Queries Using Distributed Hash Tables
